resources.name: NewVoucher
resources.description:
# Introduction
This documentation tries to explain how to use the iVoucher api in [IvoucherApi]({{ _.base_url }}). The url of the environment base_url can be changed using the select box in the top left corner of the page. The current url is {{ _.base_url }}.

# Default rules
All index routes have default rules, in query system you can set the limit and the offset of your query using query params

## request example
GET <{{ _.base_url }}/products?limit=1&offset=1>
~~~json
{
  {
    "meta": {
      "total": 2,
      "per_page": 1,
      "current_page": 1,
      "last_page": 2,
      "first_page": 1,
      "first_page_url": "/?page=1",
      "last_page_url": "/?page=2",
      "next_page_url": "/?page=2",
      "previous_page_url": null
    },
    "data": [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "coca cola",
        "description": "preciso dizer mais alguma coisa <Local>Rua 18 de dezembro</Local><Teste>Teste</Teste>",
        "value": 5,
        "value_voucher": 4,
        "visible": false,
        "in_percent": false,
        "branch_id": 1,
        "product_banner": 1,
        "promotion_id": null,
        "created_at": "2021-01-12T05:48:27.331-03:00",
        "updated_at": "2021-01-12T05:48:27.331-03:00",
        "banner": {
          "id": 1,
          "file": "1610441301868.jpeg",
          "name": "ExodiaCardsJP.jpg",
          "type": "image",
          "subtype": "jpeg",
          "created_at": "2021-01-12T05:48:21.882-03:00",
          "updated_at": "2021-01-12T05:48:21.886-03:00",
          "url": "http://localhost:3333/midias/1"
        },
        "service": {
          "id": 1,
          "capacity": 1,
          "private": true,
          "type": "TOUR",
          "product_id": 1,
          "created_at": "2021-01-12T07:11:14.659-03:00",
          "updated_at": "2021-01-12T07:14:26.749-03:00"
        },
        "finalValue": 4
      }
    ]
  }
}
~~~

The system has 4 user levels. They're: cooperative, business, affiliated and standard. Some routes are protected to only be used by their respective levels.

The authentication uses the bearer token pattern. To use the token, fill the Authorization header with the user token.

**:branch_id**: an id from an existing branch.

resources.name: Store

{

	cpf: string, required,
	first_name: string,
	last_name: string,
	installments: integer, required
	email: string, required
	token: string

resources.name: Store
resources.description:
Used to create a product.

POST <http://{host}:{port}/products> 

## Request body rules
~~~typescript
{
	name: string, required //the name of the product
	description: string, required //the description of the product
	value: number, required //the value of the product
	value_voucher: number, required //the value of the product voucher
	productBanner: number //an id from an existing media to become the banner of the image
	branchId: number, required //an id from an existing branch
  promotionId: number, //an id from a existing promotion to be attached to the product
  visible: boolean //the actual visibility of the product
  in_percent: boolean //a modifier for the voucher to change de final value by overide or percent
}
~~~
## Response rules
~~~typescript
{
  "product": Product  // the created product
}
~~~
